--- Robert Watkins <yahoo@t...> wrote:
> When you do parameterised tests in=
 JUnit 3, you typically
> override the runTest method - this frees you up t=
o set the
> name, as it won't be used for the reflection-based test
> runni=
ng. I always make the test name something meaningful,
> based on the parame=
ters coming in. A least effort approach
> would be to include the _number_ =
of the parameter
> (e.g. parameter set 5 of 10).

Yes, I think that every t=
est needs a meaningful name.  Technically, 
a "moniker."  Given the name/mo=
niker of a failing test, it should be 
possible to automatically recreate a=
nd rerun just that test.  That is, 
from "testThis(3 of 10)" or "testThis(5=
,'hello',true)", it should be 
possible to construct and run a test instanc=
e equivalent to the 
original.  (And I'm saying "should" in the sense of, "=
The tool would 
be most useful if it did things this way.")
